Posts.Content: CindyT wrote: Just looking for some insight from all of you brave women.  I started off with a 4cm IDC.  I have been on Arimidex for 6 months now and it has shrunk to about 1.5cm total, mass was shaped kind of like a barbell, therefore kind of spread out.  Original plan was a lumpectomy, then a month ago BS called me and said she didn't think she could do a lumpectomy I probably needed a mastectomy.  That of course did not make me happy.  After presenting my case to the tumor board they decided to keep me on the Arimidex for another month and try a lumpectomy.  They said since I really wanted to keep my breast that I would probably be happy with a somewhat less than perfect looking breast.  I don't know what exactly that means or if I will be happy if it looks really bad. So I have to decide between MX, LX, BMX.  We don't know if I have a MX if I will need rads until after the surgery.  No lymph node involvement shows on the MRI or US, but of course it could be microscopic.  So of course radiation can cause complications with reconstruction after MX or if I have a LX with a signifignant defect there won't be much to do to fix it after rads.  So the decision is to keep my own breast knowing it may not look very good or a MX with reconstruction that may have a 50% complication rate if I need rads.  I see so many women having MX with immediate reconstruction, how do they know if they will need radiation or not?  I am so confused as to what to do! Dx 8/2011, IDC, 4cm, Stage II, Grade 2, 1/4 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Sep 6, 2011 08:49PM CindyT wrote: Thanks all.  OK, I got by MRI and Her2 results back today.  MRI shows the 4 cm. mass, no enlarged lymph nodes.  Her2 negative.  So the tenative plan is to start on hormone therapy, since it is 100%ER+ and 95% PR+, chemo to shrink the tumor and them lumpectomy.  I am seeing the Onco tomorrow for all the details.  I am still afraid but feeling a little better. I am sure there will be lots more fear and anxiety but as you all have told me, it's better when I have information and a plan.  My BS assured me that she is pretty sure it has not spread anywhere which was my biggest fear.  I don't feel as if I am going to die tomorrow!  Hugs to all of you and best wishes for positive outcomes for all of us.
Posts.Title: Fear CindyT jazz3000

Posts.Content: Sep 6, 2011 09:47PM CindyT wrote: So sorry to hear that you are positive Martygra.  It just seems so wrong that they tell you that you have cancer and then you have to wait a week to know anything else.  That was such a nightmare week for me.  It was difficult just to breathe, let alone do anything else. I feel like I can breathe a little now but like you I am still terrified.  Wish I could do something for you to help you through it.  I guess we will have to try and help each other as we have a long hard road ahead.  Right now I am just trying to stay in the moment, it's not easy. We are the same age, I am also 54.  Big hugs to you.

Posts.Content: Sep 7, 2011 08:58PM - edited Sep 7, 2011 10:35PM by CindyT Well I went to the Onco today and it went better than I thought.  I was sure I would be leaving there with a plan for chemo to shrink the tumor before a lumpectomy.  She instead put me on Arimidex to shrink the tumor since it was ER +& PR +  at 100%.  She is pretty confident it will shrink the tumor within 3 months and we can do a lumpectomy.  I will only need chemo if the Onco type is high.  Rads of course will be needed after lumpectomy.  Any one familiar with this routine?
Posts.Title: Fear CindyT jazz3000

Posts.Content: Sep 4, 2011 05:54PM - edited Sep 4, 2011 06:10PM by CindyT Wow, I am in tears at the overwhelming support from all of you.  I am starting to feel(for the moment anyway!) that it will be OK.   I wish the best for all of you also.  I am seeing a breast surgeon at University Medical Center in Tucson, they have a great reputation.  Have not seen an Onco yet, waiting for the MRI  and FISH test to come back as to how to proceed.  They will call me on Tuesday. I feel that I am waiting too long, I want to take care of this now, before it gets any worse.   I see a lot of you choose Mastectomy over lumpectomy when it seems that your tumors are not as large as mine seems to be.  I guess there is still a lot more information I will need to make any decision. I do think I will feel better when I have some kind of plan.  I am afraid of what the MRI and FISH test will show, hopefully it will be some good news, and I will be able to make some decisions.  Thank you all so much and hugs to you all.
Posts.Title: Fear CindyT jazz3000

Posts.Content: Sep 7, 2011 10:42AM CindyT wrote: I didn't understand that either, I kept asking that question, and why didn't I notice it sooner?  BS says that it happens a lot like that.  And I have dense breast tissue which is why she said I didn't notice it sooner.  I keep beating myself up over not paying closer attention.  But to tell the truth I never even thought I would get BC, I'm the healthiest person I know, no history in my family etc.  Yesterday I was relieved that I had the option of a lumpectomy and BS assured me that she's pretty sure it is localized but today I am seeing the onco and am terrified of the chemo and TX to come.
